DataElement.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) Edition 7 Group Stage
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Stage group determined from information on the tumor (T), regional node (N) and metastases (M) and by grouping cases with similar prognosis for testicular carcinoma.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor Stage Grouping
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor. -- 2004

Concepts.longName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Property.preferredDefinition: Stage Grouping; an assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage. (caDSR)

Concepts.longName: Stage Grouping
Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.origin: AJCC Based:Staging Criteria Based on American Joint Committee on Cancer System
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CRF standard harmonization. mc 1/31/17

ValueDomain.preferredName: Testicular Cancer American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 7 Group Stage
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage._The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A finding indicating that the extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

Concepts.longName: Stage Unknown
Concepts.definition: The extent of organ/tissue involvement by a malignant neoplasm is not reported or not assessed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIC includes: (Any pT/TX, N1-3, M0, S3); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S3); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1b, Any S).  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. M1a: Non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis.  M1b: Distant metastasis other than to non-regional lymph nodes and lung.  S3: LDH more than 10 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) or hCG more than 50,000 or AFP more than 10,000. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIC Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIC includes: (Any pT/TX, N1-3, M0, S3); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S3); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1b, Any S).  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. M1a: Non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis.  M1b: Distant metastasis other than to non-regional lymph nodes and lung.  S3: LDH more than 10 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) or hCG more than 50,000 or AFP more than 10,000. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIB includes: (Any pT/TX, N1-3, M0, S2); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S2).  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. M1a: Non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis. S2: LDH 1.5-10 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) or hCG 5,000-50,000 or AFP 1,000-10,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIB Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIB includes: (Any pT/TX, N1-3, M0, S2); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S2).  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. M1a: Non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis. S2: LDH 1.5-10 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) or hCG 5,000-50,000 or AFP 1,000-10,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIIA includes: (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S0); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S1).  M1a: Non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIIA Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIIA includes: (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S0); (Any pT/TX, Any N, M1a, S1).  M1a: Non-regional nodal or pulmonary metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage III is divided into stage IIIA, stage IIIB, and stage IIIC, and is determined after a radical inguinal orchiectomy (surgery to remove the testicle) is done. In stage IIIA, cancer is anywhere within the testicle, spermatic cord, or scrotum; may have spread to one or more lymph nodes in the abdomen; and has spread to distant lymph nodes or to the lungs; tumor marker levels may range from normal to slightly above normal. In stage IIIB, cancer is anywhere within the testicle, spermatic cord, or scrotum; and may have spread to one or more lymph nodes in the abdomen, to distant lymph nodes or to the lungs; the level of one or more tumor markers is moderately above normal. In stage IIIC, cancer is anywhere within the testicle, spermatic cord, or scrotum; and may have spread to one or more lymph nodes in the abdomen, to distant lymph nodes, or to the lungs; the level of one or more tumor markers is high; OR, cancer is anywhere within the testicle, spermatic cord, or scrotum; and may have spread to one or more lymph nodes in the abdomen; and has not spread to distant lymph nodes or the lung but has spread to other parts of the body; tumor marker levels may range from normal to high.

Concepts.longName: Stage III Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage III includes: Any pT/TX, Any N, M1, SX.  M1: Distant metastasis. SX: Marker studies not available or not performed.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIC includes: (Any pT/TX, N3, M0, S0); (Any pT/TX, N3, M0, S1).  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIC Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIC includes: (Any pT/TX, N3, M0, S0); (Any pT/TX, N3, M0, S1).  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIB includes: (Any pT/TX, N2, M0, S0); (Any pT/TX, N2, M0, S1).  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  M0: No distant metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIB Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIB includes: (Any pT/TX, N2, M0, S0); (Any pT/TX, N2, M0, S1).  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  M0: No distant metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IIA includes: (Any pT/TX, N1, M0, S0); (Any pT/TX, N1, M0, S1).  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  M0: No distant metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IIA Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IIA includes: (Any pT/TX, N1, M0, S0); (Any pT/TX, N1, M0, S1).  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  M0: No distant metastasis. S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage II includes: Any pT/TX, N1-3, M0, SX.  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. SX: Marker studies not available or not performed.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage II Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage II includes: Any pT/TX, N1-3, M0, SX.  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N1: Metastasis with a lymph node mass 2 cm or less in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, none more than 2cm in greatest dimension.  N2: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension; or multiple lymph nodes, any one mass greater than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm in greatest dimension.  N3: Metastasis with a lymph node mass more than 5 cm in greatest dimension. M0: No distant metastasis. SX: Marker studies not available or not performed.  (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IS includes: Any pT/TX, N0, M0, S1-3.  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  S2: LDH 1.5-10 x N or hCG 5,000-50,000 or AFP 1,000-10,000.  S3: LDH more than 10 x N or hCG more than 50,000 or AFP more than 10,000. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IS Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IS includes: Any pT/TX, N0, M0, S1-3.  pTX: Primary tumor cannot be assessed.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S1: LDH less than 1.5 x N (N indicates the upper limit of normal for the LDH assay) and hCG less than 5,000 and AFP less than 1,000.  S2: LDH 1.5-10 x N or hCG 5,000-50,000 or AFP 1,000-10,000.  S3: LDH more than 10 x N or hCG more than 50,000 or AFP more than 10,000. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IB includes: (pT2, N0, M0, S0); (pT3, N0, M0, S0); (pT4, N0, M0, S0).  pT2: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis with vascular/lymphatic invasion, or tumor extending through the tunica albuginea with involvement of the tunica vaginalis.  pT3: Tumor invades the spermatic cord with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  pT4: Tumor invades the scrotum with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IB Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IB includes: (pT2, N0, M0, S0); (pT3, N0, M0, S0); (pT4, N0, M0, S0).  pT2: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis with vascular/lymphatic invasion, or tumor extending through the tunica albuginea with involvement of the tunica vaginalis.  pT3: Tumor invades the spermatic cord with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  pT4: Tumor invades the scrotum with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage IA includes: pT1, N0, M0, S0.  pT1: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis without vascular/lymphatic invasion; tumor may invade into the tunica albuginea but not the tunica vaginalis.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage IA Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage IA includes: pT1, N0, M0, S0.  pT1: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis without vascular/lymphatic invasion; tumor may invade into the tunica albuginea but not the tunica vaginalis.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage I includes: pT1-4, N0, M0, SX.  pT1: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis without vascular/lymphatic invasion; tumor may invade into the tunica albuginea but not the tunica vaginalis.  pT2: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis with vascular/lymphatic invasion, or tumor extending through the tunica albuginea with involvement of the tunica vaginalis.  pT3: Tumor invades the spermatic cord with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  pT4: Tumor invades the scrotum with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  SX: Marker studies not available or not performed. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage I Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage I includes: pT1-4, N0, M0, SX.  pT1: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis without vascular/lymphatic invasion; tumor may invade into the tunica albuginea but not the tunica vaginalis.  pT2: Tumor limited to the testis and epididymis with vascular/lymphatic invasion, or tumor extending through the tunica albuginea with involvement of the tunica vaginalis.  pT3: Tumor invades the spermatic cord with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  pT4: Tumor invades the scrotum with or without vascular/lymphatic invasion.  N0: No regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  SX: Marker studies not available or not performed. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Stage 0 includes: pTis, N0, M0, S0.  pTis: Intratubular germ cell neoplasia (carcinoma in situ).  N0: regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

Concepts.longName: Stage 0 Testicular Cancer AJCC v6 and v7
Concepts.definition: Stage 0 includes: pTis, N0, M0, S0.  pTis: Intratubular germ cell neoplasia (carcinoma in situ).  N0: regional lymph node metastasis.  M0: No distant metastasis.  S0: Marker study levels within normal limits. (AJCC 6th and 7th eds.)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A malignant tumor predominantly affecting young men and often associated with cryptorchidism.  Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.:A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.:An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage.:The extent of a cancer in the body. Staging is usually based on the size of the tumor, whether lymph nodes contain cancer, and whether the cancer has spread from the original site to other parts of the body.

Concepts.longName: Malignant Testicular Germ Cell Tumor
Concepts.definition: A malignant germ cell tumor that arises from the testis. It predominantly affects young men. Seminoma is the most frequently seen malignant testicular germ cell tumor, followed by embryonal carcinoma and yolk sac tumor.

Concepts.longName: American Joint Committee on Cancer
Concepts.definition: A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications.

Concepts.longName: Stage Grouping
Concepts.definition: An assessment based on the combined evaluation of the patient's T stage, M stage, and N stage, as well as prognostic parameters for specific cancers.

Concepts.longName: Neoplasm Stage
Concepts.definition: The extent of a cancer in the body.
